OVERVIEW: The Coils series consists of well drained soils that are moderately deep to a strongly cemented duripan. These soils formed in alluvium derived from mixed volcanic and sedimentary rocks. Coils soils are on fan piedmonts. Slopes are 0 to l5 percent. The mean annual precipitation is about 250 mm and the mean annual temperature is about 7 degrees C.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine, smectitic, frigid Haploxeralfic Argidurids

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Eureka County, Nevada; approximately 34 miles northwest of Eureka near Coils Creek; about 50 feet west and 1,400 feet south of the northeast corner of Section 32, T. 23 N., R. 49 E.; USGS Three Bar Ranch 7.5 minute topographic quadrangle; latitude 39 degrees 49 minutes 13 seconds N and longitude 116 degrees 28 minutes 41 seconds W; WGS84 Decimal Degrees 39.8202778 latitude, -116.4780556 longitude.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Soil moisture: Moist in winter and spring, dry in early June through October; aridic soil moisture regime bordering on xeric.
Mean annual soil temperature: 7 to 8 degrees C.
Depth to duripan: 50 to 100 cm, commonly 56 to 76 cm.
Reaction: Neutral or slightly alkaline.
Particle-size control section - Clay: 35 to 45 percent.
Rock fragments: 5 to 20 percent.
A horizon
Value: 6 or 7 dry, 4 or 5 moist.
Chroma: 2 or 3.
Bt horizon
Hue: 7.5YR or 10YR.
Value: 5 or 6 dry, 3 through 5 moist.
Texture: Clay loam, gravelly clay loam, clay, or gravelly clay.
Btk horizon
Value: 6 or 7 dry, 4 through 6 moist.
Chroma: 4 through 6.
Texture: Clay loam or gravelly clay loam.
Clay: 30 to 40 percent.
Rock fragments: 10 to 25 percent, mostly gravel. Effervescence: Slightly effervescent or strongly effervescent.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES: This is the Timblin series. Timblin soils have an E horizon and are moist for short periods in the summer.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING: Coils soils are on fan piedmonts. These soils formed in mixed alluvium weathered from volcanic and sedimentary rocks. Slopes are 0 to l5 percent. Elevations are 1,895 to 2,135 meters. The climate is cool, semiarid with moist winters and dry summers. The mean annual precipitation is 200 to 300 mm, mean annual temperature is 7 to 8degrees C, and the frost-free season is 70 to 100 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS: These are the Decan, Handy, and Vicu soils. Decan soils have a mollic epipedon and an indurated duripan.  Handy and Vicu soils lack a duripan.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND SATURATED HYDRAULIC CONDUCTIVITY: Well drained; medium runoff; moderately low saturated hydraulic conductivity.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION: Rangeland and wildlife habitat. The present vegetation is mainly Wyoming big sagebrush, low Douglas rabbitbrush, and Indian ricegrass.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT: North-central Nevada. These soils are moderately extensive. MLRA 28B.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Davis, California

ORIGIN.content: SERIES ESTABLISHED: Eureka County Area, Nevada, l983.

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:  Diagnostic horizons and features recognized in this pedon are:
Mollic epipedon - The zone from the surface to 13 cm (A1 and A2 horizons).
Argillic horizon - The zone from 13 to 66 cm (Bti, Bt2 and Btk horizons).
Indurated duripan - The zone from 66 to 94 cm (Bqkm horizon).
Particle-size control section - The zone from 13 to 53 cm (Bti, Bt2 and part of the Btk horizons).
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
